meanings.definition: To set in from the margin.
meanings.sent1: She was indenting the text to make it look neat.
meanings.sent2: The secretary was indenting the paragraphs in the report.
meanings.sent3: Indenting the paper made it easier to read.
meanings.sent4: Her kindness indents deeply in my heart.
meanings.sent5: The indentation in the sand showed where the turtle had nested.

meanings.sent1: The indenting on the paper made it look professional.
meanings.sent2: He noticed the indenting at the beginning of each paragraph.
meanings.sent3: The indenting on the cake made it look fancy.
meanings.sent4: The mountain range had deep indentings from erosion.
meanings.sent5: The sculptor added indenting to create texture in the clay.
